page.title: 17BEDE BURN J.M.I.
page.content: Bede Burn JMI was opened in 1974 to replace an older building built in 1872. It is called a clasp building. The school is semi-open plan with 7 teaching areas and three small quiet rooms, an audio-visual room and a hall used for assembly and dinners. 214 children attend in 1985. There are 8 classes, 8 teachers and a headteacher called Mr Coverdale. Assemblies are held 3 times a week. All children attend swimming lessons at Hebburn Swimming Pool. Children have English Language, Maths, Topic Work, Physical Education as well as craft work such as cooking, sewing, painting, weaving, clay modelling and lino printing. The school has a {kiln} where pottery models are fired. The children are divided into two houses for sports activities, they are Bede {green}and Palmer {red }names of local people.
